Issues: Centralization of data, services, resources
Data Silos
SPoF
Lack of trust between computing parties
Difficulties establishing trust
Costs of SSI development
Higher development costs for new, under-experimented technologies
Difficulty preventing linkability and profiling due to system and data structures design, and/or designing anonymity support
Ref: Kassem 2019, Der 2017, Frederiksen 2019, Rathee 2022, Werner 2017, Satybaldy 2024

Issues: Lack of interoperability/portability due to the system design
Description: The standards are there, but the system designers disregard them and create an isolated environment

Issues: Lack of user trust due to reputation of the system
Description: Either bad reputation of governance actors or history of securityand privacy violations

Issues: Lack of user trust due to uncertain compliance or implementation of security and privacy safeguards
Ensuring trustworthiness of the user
Description: This is not really a threat, but rather a threat enabler

Issues: Lack of enforceability fo privacy and data protection rights
Management of dynamic user groups
Incompatible access control methods (among federations' OPs)
Composition of federated services
Managing different user types: regular users, IoT, digital user
Description: Complicates AC bc of the different access requirements, capabilities, and access methods

Issues: Lack of integration with traditional IdMs due to systems and data incompatibility
Device Compatibility
Description: Can be a substantial obstacle in developing countries

Issues: Identification of all relevant identities
Description: This is something that is done at design it. Thought hard, can ony be tackled by the design itself.

Issues: Heterogeneity of various identities (data formats & interfaces)
Lack of reusability of identities
Description: You could attribute this to regulations, but not that much, just a bit

Issues: Difficulty deleting user data due to poor data minimization and sharing practices
Data handling mechanisms lack transparency
Lack of data minimization compliance control
Reliance on end-user for data safety practices
Struggle to gain access to proof of legal identity due to inequities and administrative barriers associated with the implementation of identification and registration systems
Diversification of risk profiles linked to different access rights
Transformation from RBAC to ABAC
Design hinders compliance with national or international regulations
